title: LCS Format
body:
So I've had this conversation with my brother and I think the UoL v. Gambit game really cements it. The EU and NA LCS groups should play best of 2 or best of 3 series during the regular season. UoL look so different than the hit or miss team that they were during the regular season when they had the chance to play a few games at a time. I personally don't think that the best of one format gives us a good feel for how good or bad teams are in the NA/EU regions. 

Edit:
They should also split up the games to not be on 2 days a week but should have games spread across the whole week. That would allow a 2+ game format to work and help those of us who need our LCS fix get it all week long.

replies.body: I think it's fine now, but if they implemented bo2 or bo3 they'd need to spread it out throughout the weeks. I do think more games would be more beneficial to the teams.
Why would it not be beneficial?
My apologies, I read that too fast the first time.
I like how it is played in the LPL, there you always have a best of 2 between the teams

LPL Isn't a best of 2. It is a Series of 2 (I know semantics), but their system works on a point system. 3 points if you win 2:0 1 point for each team with a 1:1 and 0 points for 0:2 loss.

:3
it not that hard to make a best of 3 format make it 3 days a week not 2 days.

Best of 1s are limiting EU/NA LCS potential (ooooo), I have constantly thought that Best of 3 (LCK) is optimal in all sense. Even a Series of 2 (LPL) are more beneficial than a single game.

Time is the factor. Riot has this deadset mentality that fans have to watch EU **AND** NA and LPL and LCK. So they scheduled them (at least EU/NA) around each other. Which really just crushes the ability for those two regions to play more.

Think about this. 4 days for NA/EU LCS Starting Thursday and going to Sunday. Same days as EU/NA LCS are doing now. Teams still have two matches to play against teams, but the matches are best of 3. Now here is the twist, both EU LCS and NA LCS go on at the same time!!! 4 days for EU and 4 days for NA (times of course would vary). 

The most obvious issue with this is teams losing out on practice time, but if the teams matches were only on two days. The teams would still have 5 days of practice, it may require that teams get more scrim partners (as if they constantly scrim the same teams, those teams may not be available in this format).

I think it would over all improve skill/experience for NA/EU. Current NA/EU Format Sucks. PJSalt

NA/EU LCS I think needs to adapt the Korean schedule where they have best of 3s and spread the games from Wednesday to Saturday. In NA/EU they try to cram it all in 4 days and I think that they don't need to do that. Spread the series out throughout the week and it would be great.
In korea they do a best of 3 (first to 2) in the regular season, I think its a great format, but I don't think there is enough time.
No there is not, at least not with doing all the games in 2 days. If we spread it out across the week I think that would mitigate that issue.
